entry.title: Russia Evacuates Civilians From Parts of Ukraine Ahead of Kyiv Counteroffensive
entry.content: The evacuations are the latest step Russian officials have taken to consolidate their hold on occupied parts of Ukraine ahead of an expected Ukrainian offensive to retake lost territory.

entry.title: Prison vs. Harvard: The Debate Rematch
entry.content: The Bard Prison Initiative team has built an impressive record—and international reputation—since its unlikely 2015 victory.

entry.title: King Charles III Is Crowned in Lavish Coronation Ceremony
entry.content: The coronation marked the new Carolean era with a star-studded guest list, thousands of marching soldiers and a ceremony that both celebrates a millennium of history and reflects a more modern, diverse Britain.

entry.title: King Charles Inherits Bulging Royal Purse Thanks to Property Boom
entry.content: Behind the royal wealth is a booming real-estate portfolio of bucolic farms, wholesale warehouses and prime London offices that has helped cover a royal spending spree.

entry.title: The Journalists Risking Their Freedom to Keep Reporting From Russia
entry.content: Even before the arrest of Evan Gershkovich, journalism was dangerous. The few independent Russian reporters still in the country speak about their work and the risks they face.
